comments.label: [[Typical Wear]] Note
comments.text: Typical wear was observed on flooring surfaces at (location). These conditions are common in previously owned homes and are cosmetic in nature.
comments.notesToAI: Use when normal wear is present, such as scuffs, scratches, or minor cosmetic imperfections.

comments.label: [[Loose Flooring]] Repair
comments.text: Loose or unsecured flooring material was observed at (location). This should be repaired to help prevent further deterioration or tripping hazards.
comments.notesToAI: Use when flooring squeaks, shifts, lifts, or is not fastened securely.

comments.label: [[Damaged Flooring]] Repair
comments.text: Damaged flooring was observed at (location). Repair or replacement is recommended as needed.
comments.notesToAI: Use for chipped, gouged, split, or moisture-damaged floor surfaces.

comments.label: [[Damaged LVP]] Repair
comments.text: Loose or damaged LVP flooring was observed at (location). Repairs are recommended.
comments.notesToAI: Use when luxury vinyl plank is lifting, separating, curling, dented, or cracked.

comments.label: [[Cracked Tile]] Monitor / Possible Repair
comments.text: Cracked tile was observed at (location). Monitor for additional cracking. Replacement may be desirable for cosmetic or functional reasons.
comments.notesToAI: Use when tile cracks appear isolated and no active movement or moisture intrusion is confirmed.

comments.label: [[Trip Hazard – Transition]] Repair – Safety Issue
comments.text: A flooring transition at (location) is raised and presents a trip hazard. Adjustment or repair is recommended for safety.
comments.notesToAI: Use when height differences at floor transitions exceed a safe threshold or create a noticeable lip.

comments.label: [[Trip Hazard – Uneven Floor]] Repair
comments.text: Uneven flooring was observed at (location), creating a trip hazard. Repairs are recommended.
comments.notesToAI: Use when floors are noticeably sloped, lifted, or sunken enough to cause tripping.

comments.label: [[Poor Installation]] Monitor
comments.text: Flooring installation appears to be of lower workmanship quality at (location), such as uneven seams or misaligned boards. This is primarily cosmetic.
comments.notesToAI: Use when flooring shows cosmetic flaws due to poor installation but no structural defect.

comments.label: [[Gaps in Flooring]] Improve
comments.text: Gaps in flooring were noted at (location). Repairs may be desirable for appearance or to prevent debris accumulation.
comments.notesToAI: Use when gaps between flooring planks are visible but not causing performance issues.

comments.label: [[Carpet Wear]] Note
comments.text: Carpet wear was observed at (location), consistent with age and use.
comments.notesToAI: Use when fraying, matting, or discoloration represents normal age-related wear.

comments.label: [[Carpet Loose]] Repair
comments.text: Carpet is loose or buckled at (location). Stretching or reinstallation is recommended to help prevent tripping.
comments.notesToAI: Use when carpet ripples, lifts, or forms ridges that create a hazard.
